message: i have an idea im passionate about pursuing but will they reject me based on not being a graduate?
do or do not there is no try
or wait one year
Will you be able to spend 3 months in the silicon valley focused on your startup?
yes I would - that wouldn't be a problem
heh I will still apply
@jhlee agree with @vicngtor if you are really passionate about it.. why does it matter if you get into y combinator or not.  You should build it
if you are passionate about your idea and being an entrepreneur you just need to find a way to get it done
If I tell you yes will you not apply? If you don't get in this term will you start blaming on the fact that you are a student? The answer *really* doesn't matter if you think about it.
I already live there so it's nothing new and I've already thought of taking a break from school after the three months
i guess i would just focus on school otherwise to try to graduate early
im at the point where im deciding whether to just go for it now
i would just be disappointed if that were a determining factor for yc

being foreigner... would that be a problem?

@jhlee it's not a determining factor, we funded some berkeley students on the current round
what it means is we'd need be 100% sure you're suitably determined to stick with the startup even if there are temptations to go back to school
